fields.headline: Tales from the Tabs
fields.bodyText: VIALLI OFF TO WATFORD Gianluca Vialli will replace Graham Taylor, who retires at the end of the season, as Watford's new manager. The Italian told the club's board on Monday that he needed 10 days to think about his future, but decided on Friday that he would take the job. YORKE GETS HIS SPURS Manchester United's Dwight Yorke, who has had a disappointing season at Old Trafford, is at the top of Glenn Hoddle's summer 'shopping list'. The new Tottenham boss feels Yorke will compliment Sergei Rebrov perfectly up front for Spurs. Arsène Wenger is ready to start approaching his summer targets: he's denied an Arsenal move for Brazilian international keeper Rogerio, but is chasing a pack of English talent: 'I don't think I will be buying from abroad.' He's set to rival Fulham for £3.5m Palace striker Clinton Morrison, and wants Ipswich pair Richard Wright and Titus Bramble.  John Gregory's Aston Villa job is safe. Doug Ellis says: 'It is easy to sack managers, but more difficult to find ones good enough to replace them.'  Bradford's Robert Molenaar says he wants to stay despite relegation: 'At this moment in time I expect I will stay next season.'  Paul Konchesky could quit Charlton if he's not given regular football: 'Being dropped is frustrating.'  Gustavo Poyet says Claudio Ranieri could be sacked if Chelsea don't pick up a trophy soon: 'If you are not in Europe, a big club like Chelsea will make changes quickly. One morning you are here training with one manager and the following morning it's somebody else.'  Runar Normann is set to quit Coventry and return to Lillestrom for £500,000.  Mart Poom says he doesn't expect a move from Derby to Man United reserves: 'It's just speculation. It is all if, if, if.'  Everton will sell Peter Degn and Phil Jevons as soon as the season ends. Degn wants a move back to Denmark, Barnsley want striker Jevons.  Jamie Clapham is unhappy at Ipswich after losing his place: 'I've hardly played a full game since Christmas.'  Leeds are tracking Barnsley teenager John Parkin, but are ready to listen to a Real Madrid offer for unsettled striker Mark Viduka.  Dinamo Zagreb star Zoran Pavlovic says he could join Leicester in the summer: 'Our talks are still open and a move is possible.'  West Ham have told Liverpool to forget about Frédéric Kanouté. 'He's under contract with us for some time to come,' says a spokesman.  LA Galaxy are chasing Man City's Paulo Wanchope.  Manchester United scouts have been watching French kids in the Uefa U16 championship.  David Platt says Middlesbrough haven't moved for his highly rated Forest star David Prutton.  Bobby Robson is lining-up a £3m-a-year Newcastle contract for Josep Guardiola.  Fulham plan to offer on-loan Southampton reject Luis Boa Morte a permanent move to Craven Cottage.  Peter Reid has told rival clubs to forget about Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips: 'We do not have to sell and there is no way we are a selling club.'  Spanish tabs continue to link ex-Arsenal midfielder Emmanuel Petit with a £4m move to Tottenham.  Gillingham have offered West Ham's Jimmy Bullard a week-long trial starting tomorrow.
